goal.core.program.actions

Class ActionCombo

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • goal.core.program.actions.ActionCombo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParsedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ParsedObject>, java.lang.Iterable<Action>

    public class ActionCombo
extends ParsedObject
implements java.lang.Iterable<Action>
    An ActionCombo is a list of actions that have been combined by the + operator in a Rule of an agent program.

    An action combo is executed whenever the first action in the sequence can be performed, i.e., the precondition of that action holds. Preconditions of other actions are only inspected after the actions that precede the actions in the list have been executed. If a precondition that is evaluated fails, the execution of the action combo is terminated and the remaining actions are not performed.

    Author:
    N.Kraayenbrink
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • hasFilterFocusAction

        public boolean hasFilterFocusAction()
        Checks whether one of the action in the ActionCombo is a call to a module, i.e., a ModuleCallAction with associated Module.FocusMethod.FILTER.
        Returns:
        true if at least one of the actions in the action combo is a call to a module, i.e., a focus action, with filter as associated focus method.

      • applySubst

        public ActionCombo applySubst(Substitution substitution)
        Applies the given substitution to this ActionCombo by applying it to each of the Actions that are part of this combo.
        Parameters:
        substitution - The substitution to be applied to the action.
        Returns:
        The instantiated combo action where (free) variables that are bound by the substitution have been instantiated by the corresponding terms in the substitution.

      • getOptions

        public java.util.List<ActionCombo> getOptions(MentalState mentalState,
                                     Debugger debugger)
        Searches linearly through the precondition(s) of the first action in this action combo until it finds one that holds. ALL instances of the combo for which that precondition holds are returned.

        Note that preconditions of second, third, etc. actions in the combo are NOT evaluated. An action combo can be performed if (one of) the precondition(s) of the first action holds; if preconditions of other actions in the combo fail when they are evaluated, execution of the acion combo is simply terminated.

        Parameters:
        mentalState - The run state in which the precondition(s) is (are) evaluated.
        debugger - DOC
        Returns:
        A list of all available options for this action, i.e., instances for which a precondition (the first found) of the first action holds.

      • run

        public Result run(RunState<?> runState,
         Substitution substitution,
         boolean last)
        Performs the ActionCombo.
        Parameters:
        runState - The RunState in which the action is executed.
        substitution - The substitution provided by the action's context.
        last - If this is the last possible variation we are trying to execute, e.g. after this there are no more possibilities and the action will fail.
        Returns:
        The Result of this action.
